instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: MBP 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> i7 2.9Ghz - runs off battery and PSU but 'battery not charging'
threads.message:
So, I have a Macbook Pro mid-2012 13" i7 2.9GHz. I have downloaded the schematic and the boardview file. I bought this secondhand over a year ago; it is a nice little machine, it has a major dent next to the magsafe connector, and the bottom aluminium panel doesn't fit, because, near the corner where the IR sensor is (near the arrow keys), the 'unibody' was bent inwards. I straightened that up with a pair of pliers used for car repair.
It has been fine, but I got it out from a short rest (3 months?) today, and it says 'battery not charging' 'power source : power adapter'. It runs from battery, runs from power supply, but will not charge.
I have a number of other unibody MBPs, which I can use to recharge the battery to prevent total failure (e.g. if the battery gets too low), so this isn't too urgent. However, there is 'something wrong' with the charging system.
I have tried two chargers - both don't work, but they do on other MBPs. The magsafe connector has no light (green, orange, or otherwise) at any time. SMC reset makes no difference. Most concerningly, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> has a dab of white paint on it, and it appears that this area has had 'some work done' at some stage.
I am using this system to type this with no issues (battery at 52%, not charging, on power supply). I will be mindful to not drain the battery, and have backup 15 and 17 MBPs to charge the battery if needed manually.
I have a known-good 13" charge port (ordered when this laptop didn't seem to charge but then worked fine so I never fitted it...)
Am happy for advice / questions as to initial tests. I have SMD rework station (fair quality), will order microscope from this website soon, and can get reasonable motherboard photos in the interim!
I have done the 2009 MBP 17" repair on a dead MBP - (tantalum capacitor) - it worked fine, and it is a nice computer. The cap is on a set of trailing leads - but still works fine - so can do basic soldering at least!
Thank you!

threads.title: MBP 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> i7 2.9Ghz - runs off battery and PSU but 'battery not charging'
threads.message:
You need to measure some signals on the MLB.
First check <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>; get it from pins 1/2 of <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>, near SMC.
Next look for corrosion on its area and <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> too.
Test continuity for <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL>, from pin1/<CHIP>U6900</CHIP> to charger board.
Charger board has one TVS diode and few small resistors to test also.
Post diode mode value (red probe to grounde) on SCL/SDA lines of J6950; no battery, nor charged connected.

threads.title: MBP 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> i7 2.9Ghz - runs off battery and PSU but 'battery not charging'
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?

threads.title: MBP 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> i7 2.9Ghz - runs off battery and PSU but 'battery not charging'
threads.message: Hi! Sorry for not getting round to this; I removed the board yesterday to check the voltages, connected the charger, and it gave a flashing green light (solid green with super brief orange flashes). Connecting the battery resulted in a green light that went orange. I replaced the DC-in board for good measure, but it works again - not sure for how long but will come back to this thread if it fails again!

threads.title: MBP 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> i7 2.9Ghz - runs off battery and PSU but 'battery not charging'
threads.message:
If MagSafe board was the culprit, this can be sign of fake charger.
So, advise the client to get an original 60W charger....
